p: Microalgal biomass has been consumed by the indigenous populations to survive during extreme food shortages as, depending on the species, can contain up to 70% protein or 40% of marine oils [ 101]. Protein of algae contains all essential amino acids, with some species showing comparable amino acid profiles to soybean and eggs. However, digestibility and bioavailability are also major factors as the cell wall interferes in the utilization of nutrients. To increase bioavailability of microalgae proteins a pretreatment can help disrupt the cell wall [ 56]. Schizochytrium sp is a good source of the omega-3 fatty acid DHA and its oil mechanically extracted has been accepted as a new food by the EFSA [ 102]. This can be included in infant formula, follow-on formula and other products.
